ratings.comment: This course is pretty hard considering the sheer amount of content, but Luke explains things very well for the most part. He goes above and beyond to create "fill in the blank" lecture notes for his students which is extremely helpful and saves time, and makes sure to give students many example problems which is also very helpful. Would 100% recom.
He taught amazing! Would take again.

Lectures/notes are very organized and he's great at explaining difficult concepts. He always responds to Piazza posts very quickly and offers many opportunities to get help. Also very kind and creates a welcoming learning atmosphere. I was scared to take this class from what I heard about 240 with math dept but Prof Jeffreys made it great!

He was one of the best lecturers I have had here at UW-Madison. I was worried coming into what is usually a difficult class when taken with the math department into a manageable class. He knows what he is talking about and has a lot of resources to help his students, including recorded lectures and bonus office hours ahead of exams.

Professor Jeffreys seems to be a great person and his teaching matches that. He is really knowledgeable about this subject and his notes are a really great resource. The exams are worth a large percentage of your grade since it's a math class, but they accurately follow the lecture material and homework assignments, so there aren't any surprises.
Luke is the perfect lecturer for a class like Math 240. He explains everything clearly and shows lots of care about our learning. Responds really quickly to emails or Piazza and records all lectures.

I really enjoyed Professory Jeffreys. I found his notes very helpful, and I do suggest an iPad because the notes are created and are set up for you to fill in the blanks. He posted recordings of the lectures which was great, but I do suggest going to lecture. Exams were difficult but if you did all the homework/notes/quizzes etc you should be fine.

Very good professor, a lot of work and difficult but you learn a lot. Just be ready to put in the work, not an easy A by any means. Good lecture and very organized, would recommend an iPad as notes are very fast paced.

I really enjoyed Luke Jeffreys. He was quick to post notes, lectures and respond quickly on canvas. He allows for a couple drops on both homework and quizzes. Exams are basically your whole grade about 84% but if you go to class and learn and do quizzes and homework you should be good!

Luke posts all lectures on Canvas, but I would heavily recommend attending lectures because I think it incentivizes not attending lectures (which I think messed me up for understanding some of the more difficult concepts). Overall, I think he is a good professor, just know 84% of the grade is based on exams.

As math professors come, Luke was very easy to understand and answered all questions. He posts all notes and lecture videos. He also is very active on Piazza which is a question answering site. The entire class is essentially based off of 3 exams which isn't fun.

Well organized course (uploaded notes, recorded lectures, outlined content schedule). Fairly fast-paced, but manageable. Homework was ~50% relevant, textbook examples were much more useful for preparing for the two midterms and final. The weekly quizzes varied greatly in difficulty from week to week, but are only worth 6% of the total grade.

He is okay, goes through a lot of material pretty quickly in lectures, and expects you to understand what he's doing by copying without explaining why he's doing it. He does make super helpful lecture outlines but they're only usable if you work on an iPad. Class is very test-heavy, with 84% of the grade dependent on exams. Records all lectures.
Luke is great at explaining Calculus concepts. He posts all lectures to Canvas, so no need to go to lectures. Grade is super test heavy, with 84% of the final grade split between 3 big exams.
